segments.source_content:
---
slug: /177
title: "This Week In React #177: Skia, Pigment, Mist, Storybook, shadcn/ui, Hydration Diff, Geiger, MDXTS, Remotion, WinterJS, Astro, Rolldown, Tailwind, TypeScript, Biome, INP..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 03-13-2024
---
This week it's particularly exciting to see React Native Skia reaching 1.0. But we also have many other interesting releases to look at: Pigment, Storybook, Tailwind, Rolldown, MDXTS...

segments.source_content: There were also some fun ones, such as Mist and Geist. I'm really curious to know what you think of them. Would you use these?

segments.source_content: RevenueCat gives you everything you need to monetize, analyze, and grow your app business. Effortlessly control customer access and entitlements, manage data, and experiment with pricing. See why over 30,000 apps trust RevenueCat to power their in-app purchase infrastructure.

segments.source_content: The MUI team is working on Pigment, their own zero-runtime CSS-in-JS to replace Emotion in Material UI v6. The first versions have been published to npm, including a Next.js `withPigment()` plugin. Olivier explains in a ğŸ¦ [tweet](https://twitter.com/olivtassinari/status/1765719897152127315) the motivations to create a new solution, and how it compares to existing ones (Panda, StyleX, Tailwind). Unlike all others, this one will ease the adoption for existing Emotion and Styled-Components users.

translations.fr: L'Ã©quipe MUI travaille sur Pigment, leur solution CSS-in-JS sans runtime pour remplacer Emotion dans Material UI v6. Les premiÃ¨res versions ont Ã©tÃ© publiÃ©es sur npm, incluant un plugin Next.js `withPigment()`. Olivier explique dans un ğŸ¦ [tweet](https://twitter.com/olivtassinari/status/1765719897152127315) les motivations derriÃ¨re cette nouvelle solution et ses diffÃ©rences avec les alternatives existantes (Panda, StyleX, Tailwind). Contrairement aux autres, celle-ci facilitera la migration pour les utilisateurs actuels d'Emotion et Styled-Components.
translations.en: L'Ã©quipe MUI travaille sur Pigment, leur propre solution CSS-in-JS sans runtime pour remplacer Emotion dans Material UI v6. Les premiÃ¨res versions ont Ã©tÃ© publiÃ©es sur npm, incluant un plugin Next.js `withPigment()`. Olivier explique dans un ğŸ¦ [tweet](https://twitter.com/olivtassinari/status/1765719897152127315) les motivations derriÃ¨re cette nouvelle solution et comment elle se compare aux alternatives existantes (Panda, StyleX, Tailwind). Contrairement aux autres, celle-ci facilitera l'adoption pour les utilisateurs existants d'Emotion et Styled-Components.

segments.source_content:
- Experimental React Server Components support
- Faster React control auto-generation (through `react-docgen`)
- Faster static builds in "test mode" (CLI flag `--test`)
- Built-in visual testing (through Chromatic)
- Re-architected Vite support, Vitest, Vite 5
- Improved mobile/desktop UI/UX

segments.source_content: As an open-source React meta-framework designed for Enterprise applications, [Refine](https://github.com/refinedev/refine) offers a headless solution ideal for tasks like admin panels, dashboards, and internal tools.

segments.source_content: While low-code tools may offer initial promise, they often fall short in handling complex scenarios due to scalability issues, limited customization options, and the risk of vendor lock-in.

segments.source_content: Exciting major release of React Native Skia, with an inspiring launch video! This library was first released back in 2021 by William Candillon and Christian Falch and has been heavily supported by Shopify for a long time. Now, theyâ€™ve finally released a 1.0 and itâ€™s packed with improvements and new features: Thanks to a new Paragraph API, Skia can now render rich text layouts, combining system fonts and custom fonts. Animations Hooks make it easier to build performant animations with the already existing RN Reanimated and Gesture Handler integration. Another highlight for me personally: RN Skia now also supports the web as a platform, via a package called canvaskit-js!

translations.fr: Version majeure passionnante de React Native Skia, accompagnÃ©e d'une vidÃ©o de lancement inspirante ! Cette bibliothÃ¨que a Ã©tÃ© initialement publiÃ©e en 2021 par William Candillon et Christian Falch, et a Ã©tÃ© fortement soutenue par Shopify pendant longtemps. Ils viennent enfin de publier la version 1.0, riche en amÃ©liorations et nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s : GrÃ¢ce Ã  une nouvelle API Paragraph, Skia peut dÃ©sormais afficher des mises en page de texte enrichi, combinant polices systÃ¨me et polices personnalisÃ©es. Les Animation Hooks facilitent la crÃ©ation d'animations performantes avec l'intÃ©gration existante de RN Reanimated et Gesture Handler. Un autre point fort pour moi personnellement : RN Skia prend dÃ©sormais Ã©galement en charge le web en tant que plateforme, via un package appelÃ© canvaskit-js !
translations.en: Version majeure passionnante de React Native Skia, avec une vidÃ©o de lancement inspirante ! Cette bibliothÃ¨que a Ã©tÃ© initialement publiÃ©e en 2021 par William Candillon et Christian Falch et a Ã©tÃ© fortement soutenue par Shopify pendant longtemps. Maintenant, ils ont enfin publiÃ© une version 1.0 et elle regorge d'amÃ©liorations et de nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s : GrÃ¢ce Ã  une nouvelle API de paragraphe, Skia peut dÃ©sormais afficher des mises en page de texte enrichi, en combinant des polices systÃ¨me et des polices personnalisÃ©es. Les Animations Hooks facilitent la crÃ©ation d'animations performantes avec l'intÃ©gration dÃ©jÃ  existante de RN Reanimated et Gesture Handler. Un autre point fort pour moi personnellement : RN Skia prend dÃ©sormais Ã©galement en charge le web en tant que plateforme, via un package appelÃ© canvaskit-js !
